channel.title: How to auto color?
channel.description: I was just wondering if anyone could tell me how to auto color :) I have seen scripts before, but I really want to understand it, not just copy and paste. :) Thanks.

item.title: How to auto color?
item.dc:creator: @Akriam Akriam
item.description:
@Akriam wrote:

Thanks, that helped me out No more crappy pick color for my pay script

Read full topic

item.title: How to auto color?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Cheesehunk, post:4, topic:33710”]I mostly just use Colour finding for MiniMap colour’s, but it is possible for stuff on-screen. What I do is get a 4*4 Bitmap of the Colour, then search a specific are for it, and just Get the colour. Pretty simple, right?

The Screen colours aren’t to complex either, just do What The Un-Named said: Have an original set colour. Get your player to search for it with an increasing tolerance. When it finds the colour, Move the mouse over it. If the text matches the Item, then use a GetColor; If you need an example I can whip up a template.[/quote]

You shouldn’t even need the original color in some cases if you can make your mouse movements discreet.

Example for hackman:

if(FindBitmapTolerance(x, y, Road, 1, 1, 1024, 768, 70))then
RoadColor := GetColor(x, y);

A bit vague unless you know how to script to some extent.

Read full topic

item.title: How to auto color?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I mostly just use Colour finding for MiniMap colour’s, but it is possible for stuff on-screen. What I do is get a 4*4 Bitmap of the Colour, then search a specific are for it, and just Get the colour. Pretty simple, right?

The Screen colours aren’t to complex either, just do What The Un-Named said: Have an original set colour. Get your player to search for it with an increasing tolerance. When it finds the colour, Move the mouse over it. If the text matches the Item, then use a GetColor; If you need an example I can whip up a template.

Read full topic

item.title: How to auto color?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Well to auto-color on a specific thing, you could say move the mouse there, check up-text to be sure and use Var := GetColor(coordx, coordy); as scarscaper4life already said.

You can implement this into practically everything, roads, trees, monsters. With roads you should use a bitmap of an orignal road and use a high tolerance, then search for it in the minimap area.

Read full topic

item.title: How to auto color?
item.dc:creator: @scarscaper4life scarscaper4life
item.description:
@scarscaper4life wrote:

i might not be the best at explaining it but u use dtm an bitmaps to pick colours at the cordiantes like this function

If(FindDTM(dtmname,x,y,x1,y1,x2,y2))Then
PickColor := GetColor(x,y);

the dtm name is the name of your dtm an the x,y is the location

also the x1,y1,x2,y2 are the cordinates you wish to search for the dtm within

also you could just use tolarence just pick a colour an let it find it with increasing tolerance

sorry if i didnt explain it well

edit: yah that post made me a senior memeber lol

Read full topic
